# language

**Instance Property**

A language ID that determines the language to use for displaying addresses.

## Declaration

```swift
get language(): string | null;
set language(value: string | null);
```

## Discussion

When you set the [doc://com.apple.mapkitjs/documentation/MapKitJS/Service/language] property to a language ID (such as `fr-CA` or `en-GB`), the service returns results in this language, if available. If [doc://com.apple.mapkitjs/documentation/MapKitJS/Service/language] isn’t set when initializing a [doc://com.apple.mapkitjs/documentation/MapKitJS/Service] object, then the service uses the language you provided when you initialized MapKit.

The default value is `null`. The language can be unset by setting [doc://com.apple.mapkitjs/documentation/MapKitJS/Service/language] to `null` or `undefined`.

## Creating a geocoder object

- **new Geocoder(options)**: Creates a geocoder object and sets optional language and user location properties.
- **ServiceConstructorOptions**: Common options you provide when you create a service object.
- **getsUserLocation**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the request returns results near a person’s location.
